title: Mobile Microlearning in Nursing Simulation: Professional Competency and Patient Safety Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing theory, clinical practice experience, understanding of medical protocols and patient safety standards
context.additional_context: Simulation content accessible in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Realistic virtual scenarios (emergency response, interdisciplinary collaboration) mirroring medical settings to strengthen clinical competencies.

learning_goals: Learners perform basic nursing simulation scenarios (patient diagnosis, symptom evaluation, treatment protocols) with over 90% accuracy in mobile environments.
Learners incorporate peer feedback three or more times during simulation-based problem-solving and propose improvements (e.g., medical protocol adherence, patient safety enhancements).
Learners submit nursing intervention plans reflecting real clinical settings, including patient-centered care and symptom management strategies, as part of an evaluative project.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
